intro: Gyrostemon angustifolius, commonly known as the narrow-leaf gyrostemon, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Goodeniaceae and is characterized by its slender, angular stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of tubular, violet to purple flowers that bloom during the spring and summer months. It is typically found in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Gyrostemon angustifolius is often used in native gardens for its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
